content.description: It's a tricky 2-3 move problem that starts real low on the Ninja Star boulder and goes up and to the right and finishes about halfway up the downclimb.
content.protection: Pad and a spotter since there's that pesky boulder between the Rayl and Ninja Star boulders
content.location: Starts low on the backside of the Ninja Star boulder and finishes about halfway up the downclimb.

content.description: One move wonder. Start under the lip (underneath the the good jug on Karmic Daydreams), with a decent right hand sidepull and a low incut left crimp. Make one hard move to the lip and top out direct.
content.location: Karma Boulder, exactly in the middle of the boulder. Look for the best jug on the lip and then look down.

content.description: sit start and bump hands up along both sides of arete  (the bigger boulder on the right is off)
content.location: On the section of rock, that makes up the left part of crack on Pulling Up Catus.

climbs.name: The Rayl
climbs.fa: Tim and his brother, '70s? Edwards, Greene, '90s? Devlin Gandy et al, 00s? Who knows

content.description: The first problem one sees upon entering the Hangout Area. Use a huge right hand sidepull and anything for your left. Make your way to the left leaning rail system and use it to gain the summit.
content.location: You walk by this to get to the power line trail. Easily visible even a few minutes before getting to it. Marks the entry to Mystery Boulders.

content.description: Fun, a bit reachy, watch out for the cactus. Start left, low on the pockets, make your way up right to the obvious pockets. Committing final move to a big jug. Topout is super chossy so be careful.
content.location: On the main trail toward MST, right side just above the small steep hill.

content.description: Backside of hangout boulder. Scruuunchy SDS on a sharp flake, throw to pockets, mantle above the prow. Sounds hollow and ready to explode every time I try it.
content.location: Hangout Boulder, town side

content.description: SDS on two crimps inside the bottom of the crack and pull into it with an awkward jam move. Strange sequence dependent jamming and stemming will lead you to the lip. Loose holds near the top, although they are easily avoided.
content.location: Next to The Avalanches

content.description: Traverse the Rayl Boulder left to right, back into Kuzco.
content.location: On the Rayl Boulder

content.description: Traverse from right to left then go up a flake to the top. Looks like people are going straight up the face on the right (wicked!) Whatever you choose to climb it’s a fun but loose boulder. Have fun.
content.location: Right off the trail, hard to miss.

content.description:
The right arete of the tall overhanging boulder between Emperor's New Groove II and Hangout boulder. Hard and dirty. Seldom worked. SDS to rocking over onto the slab.

Most of the top out holds seem to be sharp and then will

break

off in your hands...giving you your own ninja star.

The climb being shaded by the tree is an excellent little 5.7 boulder problem called

Slab Ninja

. More problems on the back.
content.protection:
Pad.

The tree has been there longer than most of us and doesn't get in the way of anything. Please don't fuck with the tree.
content.location:
Visible from the hike in. Next to

The Rayl.

content.description: Begin up the slab on cool pockets and pretty good feet. Must down climb!
content.location: To the right of Ninja Star and directly behind Master Killer. Look for the pepper tree

content.description: An unfinished project up the wave on the face of Ninja Star boulder. Sit start in the good pocket and high crimp to a series of dead points to shallow pockets and small crimps. Ending with a miserable but deep mono dyno to fat incut pinch. Topout is the loosest garbage of all time. Rating is questionable, but it's hard. Someone send it.
content.location: Ninja Star boulder.

content.description: Same start as kuzco, but go up and slightly left to the jug at the top.
content.location: Rayl boulder

content.description:
Chossy lowball fun

Start doubled on the sloper pads far low and right of The Emperor's New Groove 2. Establish and go for a right hand crimp followed by bumping to a jug. After that work feet and finish up onto the slab (The Ninja Star/ Chimney boulder is off. Don’t dab!)
content.location: On the Rayl Boulder. To the right of The Emperor's New Groove 2. The line goes through the cave that is right next to The Ninja Star boulder.

content.description:
Pay respects to the braddah. A loose 30lb+ block of lighter rock directly overhead make this an eye opener. Pull down not out. Try and exit slightly right to save your spotter. Potential exists for a few more lines around the trail side of this boulder. Traversing variant to an easy mantle goes right from the start.

Alex paying tribute

youtube.com/watch?v=oNscOYg…
content.protection: Pads. Awkward landing and a loose block
content.location: Few yards downhill from the Hangout Traverse.

content.description: Stand start with Left hand on the undercling and right hand in the lowest pocket. Go straight up and mantle
content.location: In between ENG2 and Kuzco on the overhanging section

climbs.name: Hangout Traverse
climbs.fa: Tim and his brother, '70s? Edwards, Greene, '90s? Devlin Gandy et al, 00s? Who knows

content.description:
The area classic. Usually started from a sit at a flat ledge on the lower side near where the two boulders meet. After moving up and left it can either hit the lip or stay low for a harder variation. A move to a hueco after a sloper ledge marks the end of the hard climbing and most mantle above the hueco.  Used to have way more holds on it under the large sloper until one day some fucking moron took a hammer to the rock (no joke).

Try one of these following variations, then make up your own:

-Doing a reversal of/starting on The Rat

-Finishing a FULL beer from ones chalk bag mid climb, a confirmed B0.

-Transfer over from the huge ledge on the low angle boulder to the right of the start of this bp. Very weird!

-Mike does an up problem under the sloper rail. It's pretty fucking hard.

-The Buddha Belly uses the low holds to the right and a sloper (the belly) to bust up to the lip.

Most trafficked route here and maybe the oldest? Have easily spent an hour playing around on this rock.

Alex doing the easy warm up a while ago.

youtube.com/watch?v=EblNCFp…
content.protection: a pad or two as there are a few little boulders just close enough to tag you.
content.location: Go past the Rayl boulder and find the big flat one with lots of chalk on it. When passing the turn for Prowler one can usually see if there are people working this problem. Equally being at the boulders offers a commanding view of the trail in from the parking area.

climbs.name: ENGII Sit Start
climbs.fa: ?? First Re-ascent after major break: maybe me 2018

content.description: SDS to ENG II. Right hand low on a pinch and left out wide, flick to the undercling and stand up. Be precise now...

climbs.name: Emperor's New Groove II
climbs.fa: Tim and his brother, '70s? Edwards, Greene, '90s? Devlin Gandy et al, 00s? Who knows

content.description:
Spread 'em out on a right hand sidepull jug and a left hand ledge. Bumps up good holds lead to a heady topout on chossy holds.

Traverse in from the start of Kronk's Komet for an added pump. Used to have a direct sit start until holds broke, thus the "II".

The Rayl

, this problem, and the

Hangout Traverse

are probably the oldest lines in the area.
content.protection: Sharp and despite being a popular line, dirty, pad or two. That pocket looks enticing but it's a buster.
content.location:
opposite

Hangout Boulder

behind

The Rayl

content.description: Traverse right to left
content.location: On the right side as you begin to enter the crag

climbs.name: Chimchimney
climbs.fa: I'd like to think I am the first fatso up this thing but prob not!

content.description: In the chimney between the two boulders. Get your feet on the top of the Rayl boulder and reach for solid jugs on the NJ face to topout. A good slickfoot.
content.protection: a beer gut or an ass like kim
content.location: The chimney

content.description: Start sitting on the uphill side of the boulder with your hands on a sweet wavy ledge. Fun sequencing to hidden holds allow access to the topout on the left. Starting on the left arete could be fun.
content.protection: lowball with a somewhat slanted landing.
content.location: On the boulders just down the climber's trail from KRMFP, heading towards the mobile home park. This is on the boulder that is across from a larger boulder with a hueco in the middle of it. The hueco problem is a shitbird but give it a shot and add it to the page when you do it

content.description:
Start on the trail side of the Boulder and go up the broken crack.

There is another problem just to the left of The Broken Crack called Kool Aid Kid that starts almost in a SDS, it involves some high feet to a fun top out. Both climbs require a jump down off the top. Bring a weed wacker and a scrub brush, it hasn't seen an ascent in ages..
content.location: CIA Boulder found just trail down from the KRMFP and next to the Little Mantle.

content.description: SDS with hands on the two crimps about halfway up the face, in the middle of the Hangout Traverse Route (shown in picture). From there, double bump up left to the 3 finger crimp and then to the small sloper just above it, change footing, then left bump again to the bigger sloper/jug above. Reach right to the crimp side-pull then top out.
content.location: Directly in the middle of the Hangout Traverse Route.

content.description:
SDS with both hands matched in the giant hole [small right boulder is off]. After a longish move to a jug, head straight up and hit two solid(ish) but fun crimps, then two pockets. Once you've got good feet, find a jug up top without pulling off one of the countless loose rocks.

Maybe a V0, maybe just a V1, not too sure especially since this is my first project up here. So yeah, some feedback would be much appreciated!
content.location: Trailside of the KRMFP Boulder.

content.description: Start on obvious jug for right hand and good crimp, reach out right and figure out the rest
content.protection: Maybe a pad if you want
content.location:
Just off the main trail to the right

Between put Josh on and pulling up cactcus

Left of tiny man
